cluster_relations.rel_desc: Instant messaging is described as a means through which social media platforms enable sharing.
remarks: Platform host not named explicitly, inferred from overall context of social media platforms.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Video calls are presented as a communication feature of social media platforms.
remarks: Platform entity inferred as the social media platforms already introduced.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social networking features are functionalities provided by social media platforms.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Function: connecting and interacting among users

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a feature or functionality provided by the platform or system represented by the object.
args.justification: In all three relations, the subject is a communication or networking functionality (instant messaging, video calls, social networking features) that is offered by the social media platform (object). The existing relation_name hint and the part-whole semantics align well with a unified predicate 'is_feature_of' from feature → platform.

All instances describe relationships where various communication or networking capabilities are features offered by a social media platform. Grouping them under a class 'platform_feature_relation' captures this family of relations more specifically than a generic part-whole or composition label.

Each relation expresses that specific features (parts) belong to or are contained within a larger system (the social media platform as a whole), which is a standard part-whole / compositional semantics.
